arts.ttl: Zaccagni Hails ”Extraordinary” Lazio Duo, Talks Italy Omission
arts.sum: Lazio captain Mattia Zaccagni is excited about the future of his club, while reserving special praise for two of his teammates. The Biancocelesti now have four wins on the bounce between the Serie A and the Europa League after earning a come-from-behind win over Empoli on Sunday afternoon at the Stadio Olimpico. arts.ttl: Lazio Boss Hails Talismanic Veteran as ‘Point of Reference’ After Empoli Win
arts.sum: Lazio overhauled an early deficit to become the first team in Serie A this season to defeat Roberto D'Aversa's Empoli. Goals from Mattia Zaccagni and Pedro turned the game on its head, firing Marco Baroni's side to their fourth consecutive triumph in all competitions. The post Lazio Boss Hails Talismanic Veteran as ‘Point of Reference’ After Empoli Win appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Super-Sub Pedro Completes Lazio Comeback Against Empoli
arts.sum: Lazio veteran Pedro came off the bench to earn this team a valuable 2-1 victory over Empoli on the seventh matchday of Serie A. The Biancocelesti were riding high on confidence after three wins in a row across all competitions, but were dealt with an early blow as their visitors managed to snatch the lead […] The post Super-Sub Pedro Completes Lazio Comeback Against Empoli appeared first on The Laziali.

arts.ttl: D’Aversa reflects on Empoli’s first defeat of the season against Lazio
arts.sum: Empoli manager Roberto D’Aversa addressed the media following his team’s first loss of the season against Lazio. Despite the defeat, D’Aversa expressed satisfaction with his team’s performance and highlighted several key points from the match. On the overall performance, D’Aversa stated, “Certainly, I’m satisfied. The boys put in an excellent performance. Despite Lazio’s missed penalty, the regret is for the first half. Going into the locker room at 0-1 would have been different. Conceding that goal instead revitalized Lazio, and the crowd made the difference.” Regarding the equalizer scored just before halftime, D’Aversa noted, “The regret is that the cross The post D’Aversa reflects on Empoli’s first defeat of the season against Lazio appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Baroni praises Lazio’s maturity in victory over Empoli
arts.sum: Lazio manager Marco Baroni expressed his satisfaction with the team’s performance following their 2-1 victory against Empoli. Speaking to the club’s official media and DAZN, Baroni highlighted the squad’s maturity and resilience in overcoming early setbacks. “The compliments are only for the team. I had asked for a show of maturity and compactness against a difficult opponent,” Baroni stated. “We made it more complicated for ourselves due to the field conditions, there was this slip by Ivan, and then going behind and missing the penalty – we put everything into it. arts.ttl: Serie A | Lazio 2-1 Empoli: Match Report
arts.sum: Lazio demonstrated their resilience by coming from behind to defeat Empoli 2-1 in a thrilling Serie A encounter at the Stadio Olimpico. The win extends Lazio’s impressive run to four consecutive victories across all competitions. The match began with an unexpected twist as Empoli took an early lead. Lazio goalkeeper Ivan Provedel slipped while attempting to deal with a Giuseppe Pezzella cross, allowing Sebastiano Esposito to head home and give the visitors a surprise advantage. Lazio’s pursuit of an equalizer was hampered by an injury to Manuel Lazzari, who was forced off with a suspected femoral bicep strain.
